definition: (literary) I, your servant (self-appellation of a lower-rank female)/(archaic) male and female slaves/subjects (of a ruler)
state official or subject in dynastic China/I, your servant (used in addressing the sovereign)/Kangxi radical 131
concubine/I, your servant (deprecatory self-reference for women)

sentences.english: Also, tonight I am going to take Your Majesty's life.
sentences.chinese: 还有，今晚臣妾，想要皇上的命。

sentences.english: But I hear he is in fact the son of a herdsman.
sentences.chinese: 不过据臣妾所知，他只是个牧马人的儿子。

definition: I, me (self-referring by a widowed empress etc, used in historical novels and operas)
the emperor/Your majesty the emperor/His imperial majesty
courtier's or minister's form of address for the current Emperor
(old) your servant (humble self-reference by young female)
queen/empress/imperial concubine/Goddess, esp. Xi Wangmu 王母娘娘 or 西王母, Queen Mother of the West/mother/aunt
state official or subject in dynastic China/I, your servant (used in addressing the sovereign)/Kangxi radical 131
